skill.name: gwas-database
skill.description: Query NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog for SNP-trait associations. Search variants by rs ID, disease/trait, gene, retrieve p-values and summary statistics, for genetic epidemiology and polygenic risk scores.
skill.summary: Query NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog for SNP-trait associations. Search variants by rs ID, disease/trait, ge...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and example queries for public GWAS Catalog APIs and FTP downloads. No credential access, environment harvesting, or executable payload patterns were found.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable SNP and trait associations can be slow and fragmented. This skill provides clear GWAS Catalog API paths and workflows for fast, repeatable queries.
actual_capabilities: Explain GWAS Catalog entities and identifiers
Provide REST API endpoints and parameters for studies, associations, variants, and traits
Show pagination and rate limiting patterns for large queries
Guide summary statistics API queries and filters
Outline FTP download workflow for study files
List key response fields and metadata to extract
limitations: Requires network access to the GWAS Catalog APIs or FTP site
Summary statistics are available only for a subset of studies
Data quality depends on published study curation
Large queries require pagination and rate limiting

use_cases.title: Trait association lookup
use_cases.description: Identify genome wide significant SNPs for a disease trait and summarize p values and effect sizes.

use_cases.title: API integration plan
use_cases.description: Design a script that paginates GWAS Catalog endpoints and caches results for repeated analyses.

use_cases.title: Variant evidence review
use_cases.description: Gather all traits associated with a specific rs ID and list study metadata for a literature review.

prompt_templates.title: Find trait hits
prompt_templates.scenario: You want SNPs for a disease
prompt_templates.prompt: List the GWAS Catalog API steps to find all associations for EFO_0001360 and filter to p â‰¤ 5e-8.

prompt_templates.title: Variant profile
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to query rs7903146 for variant details and all trait associations using the REST API.

prompt_templates.title: Gene centric search
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide the endpoint and parameters to find variants near TCF7L2 and extract associated traits.

prompt_templates.title: Summary stats query
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to query the summary statistics API for a chromosome region and filter by p value.

output_examples.input: Summarize the steps to get type 2 diabetes associations from the GWAS Catalog API.
output: Identify the EFO term for type 2 diabetes
Paginate results with size and page parameters
Filter results by p value threshold
Extract rsId, pvalue, and studyId fields

best_practices: Start with the web interface to confirm EFO terms and study IDs
Handle pagination and cache results to reduce repeat calls
Respect rate limiting with short delays between requests
anti_patterns: Assuming all studies have summary statistics available
Ignoring ancestry and sample size metadata

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is plain text and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What data limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Results are paginated and summary statistics are available only for some studies.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a Python pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides REST API patterns and examples suited to Python requests workflows.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store my private data?
faq.answer: No. It only describes public GWAS Catalog APIs and does not request local files or credentials.

faq.question: What should I do if the API returns errors?
faq.answer: Check parameters, confirm EFO IDs, and retry with smaller page sizes or delays.

faq.question: How does this compare to using the web interface?
faq.answer: The API approach supports automation, pagination, and reproducible pipelines beyond manual browsing.
